column1: Crissaegrim is a Sindarin name that includes the root kris-. meaning "Cleft Mountain Peaks". It is usually referred to as the "Abode of Eagles".
In early versions of the Quenta Silmarillion
column2: J.R.R. Tolkien used the name Gochressiel
column3: which he amended to Crisaegrim (later spelt Crissaegrim). Christopher Tolkien has noted that the name Gochressiel might not have referred exclusively to this southern section of the mountains
column4: but rather to the whole of Echoriath.
